intro: Monelasmum brachybotrys, commonly known as the short-stemmed monelasmum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries such as Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are small and clustered in whorls, typically displaying shades of pink or purple. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks.
